data.title: Small refactoring in ADVCharacter.__init__
data.body: I reduced some repeating. If you like this change, i can rewrite some more in the same fashion.

data.title: Key pressing issues on gamepads
data.body:
There are key pressing issues on gamepads:

- config.pad_bindings["pad_lefttrigger_pos"] = [ "skip" ] only activates skip, but never stops.
- D-keys navigations only move one focus on one pressing. To navigate far buttons, it requires to be pressed many times.

data.title: update failure from preferences screen
data.body:
In launcher, clicking 'update' when 'preferences' is shown (such as, when you've just changed update channels) produces a confusing error:
```
NameError: global name 'path' is not defined
```
If difficult to fix exact issue, suggest blocking updating straight from preferences.

data.title: show before scene change not taking place
data.body:
```
eileen mouthopen "Goodbye."
show eileen mouthclosed
scene newscene
with dissolve
```
Adding 'pause 0' before 'scene' is a workaround.

data.title: Add Japanese translation for new gui
data.body: It also revised previous translation.

data.title: - Fixes Lint Exception:
data.body:
AttributeError: 'FontGroup' object has no attribute 'lstrip'

where FontGroup is mistaken for font path string.

data.title: unlink_save problem.
data.body: https://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=8&t=41355

data.title: Self-voicing: add pause after character name
data.body:
I've just tested self-voicing feature and it works nicely, except for the fact that all text blocks seem to be merging into one without pause between them. The most frequent case of this is lack of pause between character name and dialogue line. This can be easily fixed with e.g. `what_alt=": [text]"` in Character definition, but i think it would be better to have such behaviour by default.

In case this is platform-specific issue, i'm running gnu/linux and thus espeak.

data.title: suggestion for Movie()
data.body: It'd make Movie() slightly less confusing to creators if the "channel" parameter were made optional, and would create a randomly-named unused channel if omitted.  (This might result in the creation of a lot of redundant channels in a game with a lot of movies, but the creator can specify a channel in that case.)

data.title: Draft of simplified Chinese translation
data.body: Begin to translate the quickstart to simplified Chinese.

data.title: Update some strings is Spanish translation / Found some typos in gui/screens.rpy
data.body:
### Update Spanish translation
- Some missing words and strings have been translated (mostly those that the final player will see, not the developer).

### Some typos in gui/screens.rpy
(This affects the translation files too)
Some sentences in the gamepad help screen have small typos:
"Advance dialogue and activates the interface."  -> Advances
"Roll back to earlier dialogue."    -> Rolls
"Roll forward to later dialogue."  -> Rolls
"Access the game menu."  -> Accesses

These sentences are the same in the keyboard help screen, but should be translated only once. They are duplicated in the translation files because of the typo.

data.title: werid error TypeError: expected string or buffer
data.body:
I have simple character:
```
pt = Character(player.name + " Thoughts",
                                color = pcolor,
                                what_prefix = "{i}", #it makes text italic
                                what_suffix =  "{/i}")
```

When I try make it to tell any thing I get this error:
`TypeError: expected string or buffer`

But when I reload(using Shift+R) every think is working.

data.title: Window size not maintained on minimize
data.body:
1. Start up a game (a completely fresh project works fine for this)
2. Resize the window
3. Go to the preferences menu and select "Window" to return it to its default size
4. Minimize the window
5. When you restore the window, it will now be the same size it was after step 2, rather than default, as expected

Based on the little experimentation I've done, this only seems to occur when following this exact sequence of steps. If the window's already a non-default size when you launch the game and you don't perform step 2, it will retain its proper size.

I don't have any other environments on hand to test with, but I have confirmed the behavior on two separate Windows 7 SP1 x64 systems, on both 6.99.11 release and the 6.99.12.1907 nightly. The user that initially reported the issue didn't specify x64 or x86, but was also running Windows 7 SP1.

data.title: decode unicode for player name in inserted text
data.body:
Not sure if the name display is a feature, having trouble tracking down the documentation...

```
define e = Character("Eileen")
define r = Character(u"Rene\xe9")

...

"I'll say hello to [e]." # shows "Eileen"
"Then I'll see what [r] has to say." # exception
```

    screen navigation():

        else:

            textbutton _("Character") action ShowMenu("character")

data.title: Getting errors installing AndroidSDK through android.py
data.body:
## First issue:
```
C:\Users\Sandipan Guha\Documents\pyworks\rapt>python android.py installsdk
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "android.py", line 10, in <module>
    import rapt.interface as interface
  File "buildlib\rapt\interface.py", line 8, in <module>
    import plat
ImportError: No module named 'plat'
```
- fixed by updating replacing `import plat` with `import rapt.plat as plat` 
**Success**

## Second issue:
```
C:\Users\Sandipan Guha\Documents\pyworks\rapt>python android.py installsdk
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "android.py", line 11, in <module>
    import rapt.install_sdk as install_sdk
  File "buildlib\rapt\install_sdk.py", line 240
    os.chmod(plat.path("android-sdk/tools/android"), 0755)
                                                        ^
SyntaxError: invalid token
```
- `platform.win32_ver()` not returning `True` in _plat.py_. Yet I'm using Win10 x64
 **Failed**

- tried importing [win32_ver.py](http://bugs.python.org/file38102/win32_ver.py) and replacing `if platform.win32_ver()[0]:` with `if platform.win32_ver()[0] or win32_Ver.win32_ver()[0]:` in _plat.py_, still returning `False` 
**Updated Console:** 
```
C:\Users\Sandipan Guha\Documents\pyworks\rapt>python android.py installsdk
('10', '10.0.10240', 'SP0', 'Multiprocessor Free')
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "android.py", line 11, in <module>
    import rapt.install_sdk as install_sdk
  File "buildlib\rapt\install_sdk.py", line 240
    os.chmod(plat.path("android-sdk/tools/android"), 0755)
                                                        ^
SyntaxError: invalid token
```
**Failed**

**Current result:** _Installation Failed_

data.title: Adding config.say_attribute_transition to LiveComposite transitions
data.body:
Note to Tom:

It would be nice if there was a `config.say_attribute_transition` equivalent for LiveComposites with interpolated variables so that renpy just adds a transition by itself whenever an interpolated variable is changed instead of having to add a `with dissolve` every time.

data.title: Transitions do not occur when changing interpolated variable on LiveComposite
data.body:
When changing the variable on a LiveComposite with interpolated variables, adding a `with dissolve` does not make the dissolve display.

```
    image hdaki1:
        LiveComposite(
            (1877, 3488),
            (0, 0), "images/Aki/[akip]/[akic].png",
            (712, 192), "images/Aki/[akip]/Mouth/[akim].png",
            (712, 192), "images/Aki/[akip]/Eyes/[akie].png",
            (712, 192), "images/Aki/[akip]/Eyebrows/[akib].png",
            (712, 192), "images/Aki/[akip]/[akiblush].png",
            (712, 192), "images/Aki/[akip]/[akitears].png",
        )

    $akip = "neutral"
    with dissolve
```

does not add the dissolve.

data.title: Live composite disappears on reload
data.body: When showing a LiveComposite, if you reload by pressing shift+r, the LiveComposite is no longer visible.

data.title: Preferences left in inconsistent state when only "game/saves" data exists
data.body:
``` renpy
define config.default_language = "english"
define config.default_text_cps = 100

label start:

    "Default language: [config.default_language]\nCurrent language: [_preferences.language]"
    "Default cps: [config.default_text_cps]\nCurrent cps: [_preferences.text_cps]"

    return
```

Starting from a completely fresh game, `_preferences.language` will be set to "english" and `_preferences.text_cps` to 100, as expected.

Close the game and delete the data in `config.save_directory`, but leave `game/saves` as it is. Start the game again, and `_preferences.language` will now be None and `_preferences.text_cps` 0. (Auto mode is also enabled for some reason.) You can fiddle with other preferences and see they are also not loaded correctly, nor set to their assigned default values.

This can happen, for example, when a user copies their game data from one machine to another. They will bring `game/saves` along with them, but not `config.save_directory`, causing their settings to be jumbled when they open the game again.

data.title: Issues on 6.99.12 launcher translation
data.body:
I was working translating ren'py launcher with the recent nightly build. It mostly worked, but I found several issues.
- While translate_font can change default font, it doesn't change _default font. Thus the developer menu can't be translated because of font issue.
- "Back" in the quick menu means "rollback", on the other hand "Back" in the launcher means "return". I need to translate them into different words.
-  Several comments are commented by '#', not '##'. Therefore, they will not be included in generated translation files. Those lines are:
1. line17 in gui.rpy # GUI Configuration Variables 
2. line167 in gui.rpy # The color of button text
3. line173 in gui.rpy # The horizontal alignment of the button text. 
4. line397 in gui.rpy # Mobile devices
5. line119 in screens.rpy # If there's a side image, display it above the text. 
6. line251 in screens.rpy # Ensure this appears on top of other screens.
7. line254 in screens.rpy # Add an in-game quick menu.
8. line358 in screens.rpy # This ensures that any other menu screen is replaced.
9. line363 in screens.rpy # This empty frame darkens the main menu.
10. line424 in screens.rpy # Add the backgrounds.
11. line437 in screens.rpy # Reserve space for the navigation section.
12. line616 in screens.rpy # The page name, which can be edited by clicking on a button.
13. line671 in screens.rpy  # range(1, 10) gives the numbers from 1 to 9.
14. line143 in options.rpy ## (space)
###### ##################################################################'

data.title: translate help page from spanish to portuguese
not everything is showing up
data.body: Whenever I open Ren'py, it doesn't show anything in my projects list. If I create a new project, the titles for the themes and colors won't appear. I don't know how to select a script editor because it doesn't show any choices (and yes, I made sure I had a script editor (jEdit)). Someone please help?? I really want to be able to use this program with limited problems.

data.title: transform can not be applied to text object in screen
data.body:
```
transform fadein:
  on show:
    alpha 0.0
    linear 2.0 alpha 1.0
  on hide:
    linear 2.0 alpha 0.0

screen test1: # doesn't work
  vbox:
    align (0.5,0.5)
    text "Hello world!" at fadein

screen test2: # works
  vbox:
    align (0.5,0.5)
    at fadein
    text "Hello world!"
```

There are a number of similar consistency issues with screen elements, and it's annoying...  Should perhaps throw an exception if it's not going to work.

data.title: Fix a few typos in docstrings
data.body:
- PEP8 style fixes while I'm in there.
- Replaced instances of "if not x in y" with "if x not in y"
- Replaced multiple "or" check with a "in list" check.
  (set or tuple check could theoretically be faster, but for such a tiny collection, I doubt there's a huge difference.)

data.title: ShowMenu action doesn't accept arguments for the screen
data.body:
Tested in 6.99.11

Example:

```
screen custom_menu(foobar):
    text foobar

screen show_button:
    textbutton "Show a menu"  action ShowMenu("custom_menu", "Hello world")

label start:
    show screen show_button
    "Some text"
```

Steps:
1) Click on the textbutton.
Result:

```
Exception: Parameter _game_menu_screen has two values.
```

Editing line 104 in common/00action_menu.rpy to remove the keyword arg appears to fix this issue:
renpy.call_in_new_context("_game_menu", _game_menu_screen=screen, _self.args, *_self.kwargs)
to 
renpy.call_in_new_context("_game_menu", screen, _self.args, *_self.kwargs)

But this feels like more of a workaround than actually fixing the core issue.

The exception is coming from apply() in ast.py.

data.title: bar "unscrollable" property issue
data.body:
While using the legacy theme interface, the property "unscrollable" doesn't seem to behave like expected.

When the screen containing it shows, the bar renders in idle status everytime. Only if hovered it disappears or become insensitive, depending on its "unscrollable" setting.
